body_content.explanation: an amount or number of something that is not stated or not known; a part of something:
examples: There's some cake in the kitchen if you'd like it.
Here's some news you might be interested in.
We've been having some problems with our TV over the last few weeks.
Could you give me some idea of when the construction work will finish?
I've got to do some more work before I can go out.

body_content.explanation: a large amount or number of something:
examples: It'll be some time before we meet again.
It was some years later when they next met.
We discussed the problem at some length.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to a particular person or thing without stating exactly which one:
examples: Some lucky person will win more than $1,000,000 in the competition.
Some idiot's locked the door!
There must be some way you can relieve the pain.

body_content.explanation: used before a noun, especially at the beginning of a sentence to show anger or disapproval, often by repeating a word that was not accurately used:
examples: Some people just don't know when to shut up.
Some help you were! You sat on your backside most of the afternoon!
"A friend of mine sold me a radio that doesn't work." "Some friend!"

body_content.explanation: used before a noun to show how good something or someone is:
examples: Wow, that was some dinner!

body_content.explanation: an amount or number of something that is not stated or not known; a part of something:
examples: If you need more paper then just take some.
"Would you like to have dinner with us?" "No thanks, I've already had some."
Some of you here have already met Imran.
Have some of this champagne - it's very good.
Some have compared his work to Picasso's.

body_content.explanation: used before a number to mean approximately; about:
examples: Some 50 tons of rock are taken from the quarry every day.
The water is some 20 to 30 metres beneath the ground.

body_content.explanation: by a small amount or degree; a little:
examples: She says she's feeling some better.
We could turn down the heat some if that would make you more comfortable.
